file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 71-12-03-04 - LOWER COWLING LATCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LOWER COWLING LATCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the lower cowling latches. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH nacelles. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 71-12-03-000-801-A LOWER COWLING LATCH - REMOVAL LOWER COWLING LATCH - INSTALLA- ALL 71-12-03-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 71-12-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-12-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. LOWER COWLING LATCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the lower cowling latches. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - OPENING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 LH engine lower cowling 423 RH engine lower cowling D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine nacelle I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breaker below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it: • START 1/2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-12-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Put the workstand in position and get access to the engine nacelle. (3) Open the lower cowling (1) ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE ENGINE COMPONENTS UNTIL THEY ARE COOL. TEMPERATURE CAN STAY HOT AFTER THE ENGINE STOPS. (1) Remove the cotter pin (7). (2) Remove the spacer (3). (3) Move away the pin (4), while you remove the washers (5) and the spacer (3). (4) Remove the latch (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-12-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY:: ALL Lower Cowling Latch - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A 1 ZONES 2 413 423 3 4 1. LOWER COWLING DET. A 3. SPACER 2. LATCH 4. PIN 5. WASHER 8. SPACER 6. WASHER DET. B 7. COTTER PIN EM145AMM710086C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-12-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-12-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. LOWER COWLING LATCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the lower cowling latches. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 54-15-00 - AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - CLOSING AMM TASK 71-12-03-800-801-A/500 LOWER COWLING LATCH - ADJUSTMENT/TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 LH engine lower cowling 423 RH engine lower cowling D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Cotter pins 54-15-00 4 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine nacelle I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the latch (2) in the installation position. (2) Position the spacer (3) in the latch (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 71-12-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Install the washers (5) on the pin (4) and install them through the latch (2). (4) Install the spacer (3). (5) Install the cotter pin (7). J. Follow on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Adjust the latch (AMM TASK 71-12-03-800-801-A/500). (2) Close the lower cowling (1) ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400). (3) Remove the workstand from the work area. (4) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breaker below and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from it: • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 71-12-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
